section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: My body was afflicted with millions of diseases.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: They have been transformed into the peaceful, tranquil concentration of Samaadhi.

This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I do not fear anyone, and I do not strike fear into anyone else. ||3||17||

translation.text: Gauree, Kabeer Jee:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None

text: ਮਨ ਰੇ ਪਵਨ ਦ੍ਰਿੜ ਸੁਖਮਨ ਨਾਰੀ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O mind, hold your breath steady within the central channel of the Sushmanaa. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: man rē pavan drir sukhaman nārī .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਸੋ ਗੁਰੁ ਕਰਹੁ ਜਿ ਬਹੁਰਿ ਨ ਕਰਨਾ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Adopt such a Guru, that you shall not have to adopt another again.

transliteration.text: sō gur karah j bahur n karanā .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Dwell in such a state, that you shall never have to dwell in any other.

translation.text: - adopt such a way of life and You shall be close to the Lord.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, meditate on the Immaculate Lord.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਤਿਤੁ ਘਰਿ ਜਾਉ ਜਿ ਬਹੁਰਿ ਨ ਆਵਉ ॥੪॥੧੮॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Go to that home, which you shall never have to leave. ||4||18||

transliteration.text: tit ghar jāu j bahur n āvau .4.18.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. translation.text: Gauree, Kabeer Jee, Ti-Padas:

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He cannot be obtained by offering your weight in gold.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. text: ਮਨੁ ਦੇ ਰਾਮੁ ਲੀਆ ਹੈ ਮੋਲਿ ॥੧॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: But I have bought the Lord by giving my mind to Him. ||1||

transliteration.text: man dē rām līā hai mōl .1.

However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. translation.text: Now I recognize that He is my Lord.

text: ਸਹਜ ਸੁਭਾਇ ਮੇਰਾ ਮਨੁ ਮਾਨਿਆ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: My mind is intuitively pleased with Him. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: sahaj subhāi mērā man māniā .1. rahāu .

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Brahma spoke of Him continually, but could not find His limit.

translation.text: Because of my devotion to the Lord, He has come to sit within the home of my inner being. ||2||

translation.text: Now, how shall I die? My mind has already accepted death.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: the arrows of the Lord's devotional worship are so sharp! ||1||Pause||

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I look upon all His soul-brides with an impartial eye;

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: how can I know which ones are dear to the Husband Lord? ||2||

text: ਕਹੁ ਕਬੀਰ ਜਾ ਕੈ ਮਸਤਕਿ ਭਾਗੁ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, one who has such destiny inscribed upon her forehead

transliteration.text: kah kabīr jā kai masatak bhāg .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਸਭ ਪਰਹਰਿ ਤਾ ਕਉ ਮਿਲੈ ਸੁਹਾਗੁ ॥੩॥੨੧॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: - her Husband Lord turns all others away, and meets with her. ||3||21||

transliteration.text: sabh parahar tā kau milai suhāg .3.21.
